catalog_info.title: Introduction to Northwest Semitic Epigraphy
catalog_info.notes: Note: This course will meet on Wednesday, September 2 , in Semitic Museum 201, 12:00noon – 2:00pm. Instructor Matt Rasure has made every effort to reach those students who expressed interest in the course, and all interested students are encouraged to come to this first class meeting if their “Monday” schedule permits. Questions? Email Matt at rasure@fas.harvard.edu. Link to class syllabus Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 1152.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Good working knowledge of Classical (Biblical) Hebrew.
catalog_info.description: Readings in Hebrew, Phoenician and other Northwest Semitic inscriptions with an introduction to methods and techniques of Northwest Semitic palaeography, and attention to problems of historical grammar.
